docs.title: Saw Simeon
docs.text:
Computational biologist — computational methods, machine learning, and bioinformatics

Mobile: Email: GitHub: https://github.com/sawsimeon

docs.title: Summary
docs.text:
I specialize in computational methods and informatics with a strong focus on molecular descriptors and fingerprints for representing chemical compounds as numerical vectors. My work combines machine learning, model explainability, and high-performance computing (HPC) to accelerate virtual screening and structure-based drug discovery. I design descriptor engineering pipelines and attribution methods that make predictive models interpretable and actionable in drug discovery workflows.

In addition to cheminformatics, I actively contribute to the Web3 and financial technology ecosystem by developing R packages for blockchain, forex trading, and cryptocurrency analytics. These packages provide interfaces to decentralized APIs, enable reproducible trading strategies, and integrate financial data streams into R’s analytical environment. My work bridges scientific computing with decentralized finance, empowering researchers and traders with transparent, reproducible, and scalable tools.

Highlights

  • Machine learning for molecular properties: predictive modeling of cell permeability, scoring functions, and bioactivity.

  • Descriptor engineering & fingerprints: development of numerical representations for chemical compounds to power ML models.

  • Post-hoc attribution & explainability: SHAP, LIME, and custom attribution methods for transparent model interpretation.

  • High Performance Computing (HPC): deep docking, large-scale rescoring, and parallelized workflows for millions of compounds.

  • Front-end development with R Shiny: interactive dashboards for data exploration, visualization, and decision support.

  • R package development for financial analytics: author of igfetchr, an R interface to the IG Trading REST API for forex and CFD trading.

  • Blockchain & Web3 integration in R: developer of nearjsonrpc, an R package to interact with the NEAR Protocol JSON RPC API for decentralized applications.

  • Rust for cheminformatics: contributor to qsar, a Rust crate for quantitative structure–activity relationship modeling and molecular descriptor computation.

  • Cross-domain expertise: bridging cheminformatics, decentralized finance, and blockchain analytics with reproducible scientific and financial workflows.

  • Technical stack: Python (Keras/TensorFlow), R (Shiny, package dev), Rust (QSAR crates), Git, SQL, and cloud/HPC environments.

• CV Details — skills, education, experience

docs.title: Areas of Expertise
docs.text:
• Computational chemistry & cheminformatics: molecular descriptors, fingerprints, and QSAR modeling for drug discovery.

  • Machine learning: deep learning (Keras/TensorFlow) and classical ML methods for molecular property prediction.

  • Model explainability & feature attribution: SHAP, LIME, and custom attribution methods for transparent decision-making.

  • Bioinformatics workflows & data analysis pipelines: reproducible pipelines for large-scale biological and chemical datasets.

  • R Shiny app development: interactive dashboards for visualization, exploration, and decision support in scientific and financial domains.

  • High Performance Computing (HPC): cluster jobs, parallel workflows, deep docking, and large-scale rescoring.

  • R package development for financial analytics: author of igfetchr, an R interface to the IG Trading REST API for forex and CFD trading.

  • Blockchain & Web3 integration in R: developer of nearjsonrpc, an R package to interact with the NEAR Protocol JSON RPC API.

  • Rust for cheminformatics: contributor to qsar, a Rust crate for quantitative structure–activity relationship modeling and descriptor computation.

  • Cross-domain expertise: bridging cheminformatics, decentralized finance, and blockchain analytics with reproducible scientific and trading workflows.

docs.title: Professional Summary
docs.text:
I specialize in computational methods and informatics with a strong focus on molecular descriptors and fingerprints for representing chemical compounds as numerical vectors. My work combines machine learning, model explainability, and high-performance computing (HPC) to accelerate virtual screening and structure-based drug discovery. I design descriptor engineering pipelines and attribution methods that make predictive models interpretable and actionable in drug discovery workflows.

In addition to cheminformatics, I actively contribute to the Web3 and financial technology ecosystem by developing R packages for blockchain, forex trading, and cryptocurrency analytics. These packages provide interfaces to decentralized APIs, enable reproducible trading strategies, and integrate financial data streams into R’s analytical environment. My work bridges scientific computing with decentralized finance, empowering researchers and traders with transparent, reproducible, and scalable tools.

docs.title: Skills
docs.text:
• Programming: Python (Keras/TensorFlow, scikit-learn, pandas, NumPy), R (tidyverse, Shiny, package development), Rust (QSAR crates), SQL, Git

  • Cheminformatics & Bioinformatics: molecular descriptors, fingerprints, QSAR modeling, docking, scoring functions, bioinformatics pipelines

  • Machine Learning: classification/regression, deep learning, feature engineering, attribution methods (SHAP, LIME), model validation, hyperparameter tuning

  • High Performance Computing (HPC): cluster workflows, parallelization for deep docking and rescoring, large-scale virtual screening

  • Web / Tools: R Shiny, interactive dashboards, data visualization, front-end interfaces for scientific and financial analytics

  • Reproducibility: best practices for computational workflows, packaging, documentation, and reproducible research pipelines

  • Blockchain & Financial Analytics: R package development for forex trading (igfetchr), cryptocurrency analytics, and blockchain/Web3 integration (nearjsonrpc)

  • Cross-domain Integration: bridging cheminformatics, decentralized finance, and blockchain analytics with reproducible scientific and trading workflows

docs.title: Education
docs.text:
• Doctor of Philosophy (Bioscience) — Kasetsart University (2016–2019) Thesis work on kinase inhibition, cytotoxicity, and volume of distribution; developed ML models using molecular descriptors and molecular simulation techniques.

  • Master of Science (Medical Technology) — Mahidol University (2013–2015) Thesis on spectral and oligomerization properties of fluorescent proteins; experience in molecular biology, biochemistry and biophysics.

  • Bachelor of Science (Biology, minor in Chemistry) — Mahidol University (2008–2012) Experimental work on tribromophenol reds and practical organic chemistry techniques.

docs.title: Postdoctoral Researcher — Biomedicinskt centrum (BMC) (Nov 2022 – Oct 2024)
docs.text:
• Developed novel molecular descriptors and applied dimensionality reduction to improve ML efficiency.
  • Built ML models for predicting cell permeability; used post-hoc attribution to explain model predictions.
  • Validated models using cross-validation and external test sets, and performed hyperparameter tuning.

docs.title: Postdoctoral Researcher — Marseille Cancer Research Center (Dec 2020 – Oct 2022)
docs.text:
• Derived datasets and features for building a scoring function for protein–ligand interactions.
  • Used HPC for deep docking and rescoring ultra-large libraries.
  • Built an R Shiny front-end integrated with ML algorithms for molecule discovery.

docs.title: Data Scientist — Absolute Clean Energy Public Co., Ltd (Nov 2019 – May 2020)
docs.text:
• Selected and evaluated microalgae strains for biomass and biogas production.
  • Performed literature reviews and compiled technical reports; authored articles on sustainable energy strategies.

docs.title: Research Initiatives Officer — Faculty of Science (Aug 2018 – Jul 2019)
docs.text:
• Managed translational research projects, presales activities and regulatory registrations.
  • Coordinated with stakeholders to commercialize research outputs.

docs.title: Good Laboratory Practice Officer — Department of Medical Science, Ministry of Public Health (Sep 2017 – Jun 2018)
docs.text: • Built interactive dashboards for monitoring lab KPIs and supported international GLP collaborations and inspections.

docs.title: Research Assistant — Mahidol University (Aug 2015 – Jul 2016)
docs.text: • Developed predictive models and Shiny applications; contributed to online tools for protein sequence analysis.

docs.title: Selected Open-source Projects & Software
docs.text:
• igfetchr — R package to fetch data from Instagram (CRAN): https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/igfetchr/index.html

  • Published on CRAN; includes data-fetching utilities and documentation for interacting with Instagram data in R.

  • nearjsonrpc — NEAR Protocol JSON-RPC API documentation and examples: https://sawsimeon.github.io/nearjsonrpc/

  • Documentation and example requests for interacting with the NEAR blockchain via its JSON-RPC interface.

  • qsar — Rust crate for QSAR tools and molecular descriptors: https://docs.rs/qsar/0.0.2/qsar/index.html

  • Rust library providing functionality related to quantitative structure–activity relationships and descriptor calculations.

  • cowr — R package (in development) to interact with Cow Protocol: https://github.com/sawsimeon/cowr

  • Ongoing work to provide R bindings and helpers for interacting with the Cow Protocol ecosystem.

docs.title: Technical Keywords (for search / SEO)
docs.text: computational biology, cheminformatics, molecular descriptors, fingerprints, QSAR, machine learning, deep learning, Keras, TensorFlow, R Shiny, HPC, docking, scoring functions, bioinformatics, model explainability, virtual screening

docs.title: Publications in International Journals
docs.text:
• Gómez-Sacristán, Pablo, Saw Simeon, Viet-Khoa Tran-Nguyen, Sachin Patil, and Pedro J. Ballester. "Inactive-enriched machine-learning models exploiting patent data improve structure-based virtual screening for PDL1 dimerizers." Journal of Advanced Research (2024).

  • Tran-Nguyen, Viet-Khoa, Muhammad Junaid, Saw Simeon, and Pedro J. Ballester. "A practical guide to machine-learning scoring for structure-based virtual screening." Nature Protocols 18, no. 11 (2023): 3460-3511.

  • Tran-Nguyen, Viet-Khoa, Saw Simeon, Muhammad Junaid, and Pedro J. Ballester. "Structure-based virtual screening for PDL1 dimerizers: Evaluating generic scoring functions." Current Research in Structural Biology 4 (2022): 206-210.

  • Saw Simeon, Ghita Ghislat, and Pedro Ballester. "Characterizing the relationship between the chemical structures of drugs and their activities on primary cultures of pediatric solid tumors." Current Medicinal Chemistry 28, no. 38 (2021): 7830-7839.

  • Schaduangrat, Nalini, Samuel Lampa, Saw Simeon, Matthew Paul Gleeson, Ola Spjuth, and Chanin Nantasenamat. "Towards reproducible computational drug discovery." Journal of cheminformatics 12 (2020): 1-30.

  • Saw Simeon and Nathjanan Jongkon. "Construction of quantitative structure activity relationship (QSAR) Models to predict potency of structurally diversed janus kinase 2 inhibitors." Molecules 24, no. 23 (2019): 4393.

  • Saw Simeon, Dino Montanari, and Matthew Paul Gleeson. "Investigation of factors affecting the performance of in silico volume distribution QSAR models for human, rat, mouse, dog & monkey." Molecular informatics 38, no. 10 (2019): 1900059.

  • Saw Simeon, Nathjanan Jongkon, Warot Chotpatiwetchkul, and M. Paul Gleeson. "Insights into the EGFR SAR of N-phenylquinazolin-4-amine-derivatives using quantum mechanical pairwise-interaction energies." Journal of Computer-Aided Molecular Design 33 (2019): 745-757.

  • Li, Hao, Nalini Schaduangrat, Saw Simeon, and Chanin Nantasenamat. "Computational study on the origin of the cancer immunotherapeutic potential of B and T cell epitope peptides." Molecular BioSystems 13, no. 11 (2017): 2310-2322.

  • Saw Simeon, Hao Li, Thet Su Win, Aijaz Ahmad Malik, Abdul Hafeez Kandhro, Theeraphon Piacham, Watshara Shoombuatong et al. "PepBio: Predicting the bioactivity of host defense peptides." RSC advances 7, no. 56 (2017): 35119-35134.

  • Saw Simeon, Watshara Shoombuatong, Nuttapat Anuwongcharoen, Likit Preeyanon, Virapong Prachayasittikul, Jarl ES Wikberg, and Chanin Nantasenamat. "osFP: a web server for predicting the oligomeric states of fluorescent proteins." Journal of cheminformatics 8 (2016): 1-15.

  • Saw Simeon, Nuttapat Anuwongcharoen, Watshara Shoombuatong, Aijaz Ahmad Malik, Virapong Prachayasittikul, Jarl ES Wikberg, and Chanin Nantasenamat. "Probing the origins of human acetylcholinesterase inhibition via QSAR modeling and molecular docking." PeerJ 4 (2016): e2322.

  • Saw Simeon, Ola Spjuth, Maris Lapins, Sunanta Nabu, Nuttapat Anuwongcharoen, Virapong Prachayasittikul, Jarl ES Wikberg, and Chanin Nantasenamat. "Origin of aromatase inhibitory activity via proteochemometric modeling." PeerJ 4 (2016): e1979.

  • Saw Simeon, Rickard Möller, Daniel Almgren, Hao Li, Chuleeporn Phanus-umporn, Virapong Prachayasittikul, Leif Bülow, and Chanin Nantasenamat. "Unraveling the origin of splice switching activity of hemoglobin β-globin gene modulators via QSAR modeling." Chemometrics and Intelligent Laboratory Systems 151 (2016): 51-60.

docs.title: Web3 Portfolio
docs.text: This page highlights my Web3 and blockchain-related projects, libraries, and documentation.

docs.title: NEAR Protocol — nearjsonrpc
docs.text:
• NEAR JSON-RPC documentation and examples: https://sawsimeon.github.io/nearjsonrpc/
  • Purpose: Reference and example requests for interacting with the NEAR blockchain programmatically using the JSON-RPC interface.
  • Includes example curl requests and code snippets to help developers interact with NEAR nodes and query on-chain data.

docs.title: cowr (R) — Cow Protocol bindings (in development)
docs.text:
• Repository: https://github.com/sawsimeon/cowr
  • Purpose: R package providing helpers and bindings to interact with Cow Protocol (continuous on-chain order workflows and MEV strategies).
  • Status: Active development — aims to simplify interacting with Cow Protocol from R and enable reproducible on-chain experiments.

docs.title: qsar (Rust) — QSAR tooling and descriptors
docs.text:
• Docs: https://docs.rs/qsar/0.0.2/qsar/index.html
  • Purpose: Rust crate providing utilities for quantitative structure–activity relationships, molecular descriptor calculations and related tooling.
  • Useful for high-performance descriptor computation in pipelines where Rust integration is beneficial.

docs.title: igfetchr (R) — CRAN package
docs.text:
• CRAN: https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/igfetchr/index.html
  • Purpose: R package igfetchr is to provide a convenient interface for accessing the IG Trading REST API, allowing users to fetch market data, query historical prices, execute trades, and retrieve account details directly within R, with results returned as tidy tibbles for easy analysis.
  • Published on CRAN; includes examples and documentation.

docs.title: Other Web3 Resources
docs.text:
• NEAR Protocol JSON-RPC Docs — Reference and examples for interacting with NEAR nodes via JSON-RPC.
  • cowr (R) — Cow Protocol Bindings — R package for interacting with Cow Protocol (in development).
  • qsar (Rust) — QSAR Tooling — Rust crate for QSAR descriptor calculations and related utilities.
  • igfetchr (R) — IG Trading API Client — R package for accessing IG Trading API data.
